PortNotesAcc.field_desc: Portfolio notes, longer description than allowed in portfolio name
PortNotesAcc.name: PortNotes

AccGroupAcc.field_desc: Account group, could use to group multiple accounts (e.g. for binders)
AccGroupAcc.name: AccGroup

AccStatusAcc.field_desc: Account status. Aside from predefined values, you can use other single character values for user specific purposes
AccStatusAcc.name: AccStatus

FlexiAccZZZAcc.field_desc: Flexible field that is stored in FlexiAcc table in ModifierName = ZZZ
FlexiAccZZZAcc.name: FlexiAccZZZ

PolStatusAcc.field_desc: Policy layer status. Aside from predefined values, other single character values for user specific purposes can be used.
PolStatusAcc.name: PolStatus

PolInceptionDateAcc.field_desc: Policy inception date - in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD
PolInceptionDateAcc.name: PolInceptionDate

PolExpiryDateAcc.field_desc: Policy expiry date - in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD
PolExpiryDateAcc.name: PolExpiryDate

LOBAcc.field_desc: Line of business (defined at policy level)
LOBAcc.name: LOB

LayerParticipationAcc.field_desc: Insurance company share of the policy layer. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% entered as 0.12)
LayerParticipationAcc.name: LayerParticipation

LayerLimitAcc.field_desc: Policy layer limit (always treated as amount)
LayerLimitAcc.name: LayerLimit

LayerAttachmentAcc.field_desc: Policy layer attachment point (always treated as amount)
LayerAttachmentAcc.name: LayerAttachment

HoursClauseAcc.field_desc: For perils with an inherent event duration, the insurance contract may contain an hours clause that limits the time in which claims can be added up and assigned to one event
HoursClauseAcc.name: HoursClause

PolLimitCode6AllAcc.field_desc: Policy blanket limit code (annual aggregate only)
PolLimitCode6AllAcc.name: PolLimitCode6All

StepTriggerTypeAcc.field_desc: Code that represents how, and for which coverages, pay-outs are triggered.
StepTriggerTypeAcc.name: StepTriggerType

StepNumberAcc.field_desc: Number between 1 and 10 that is used to sort the step function in the correct order.
StepNumberAcc.name: StepNumber

PayOutTypeAcc.field_desc: Refers to PayoutBuilding, PayoutContents, PayoutBuildingContents. Payout can be % TIV, % Loss, a monetary amount, or % Limit.
PayOutTypeAcc.name: PayOutType

TriggerTypeAcc.field_desc: Refers to TriggerStart and TriggerEnd fields which could be specified as a % TIV, % Loss or a monetary amount.
TriggerTypeAcc.name: TriggerType

TriggerBuildingStartAcc.field_desc: Starting value of the building damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.
TriggerBuildingStartAcc.name: TriggerBuildingStart

TriggerBuildingEndAcc.field_desc: Ending value of the building damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.
TriggerBuildingEndAcc.name: TriggerBuildingEnd

DeductibleBuildingAcc.field_desc: Building deductible that can be used, for example, to account for fire policies before applying step functions.
DeductibleBuildingAcc.name: DeductibleBuilding

PayOutBuildingStartAcc.field_desc: Pay-out amount for the building losses for this step. If a ramp policy then it represents the start payout value.
PayOutBuildingStartAcc.name: PayOutBuildingStart

PayOutBuildingEndAcc.field_desc: Pay-out amount for the end-point building losses for this ramp. This field should only be used if you have a ramp policy to indicate the end of the building payout. Otherwise, it should be left blank.
PayOutBuildingEndAcc.name: PayOutBuildingEnd

TriggerContentsStartAcc.field_desc: Starting value of the content damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.
TriggerContentsStartAcc.name: TriggerContentsStart

TriggerContentsEndAcc.field_desc: Ending value of the content damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.
TriggerContentsEndAcc.name: TriggerContentsEnd

DeductibleContentsAcc.field_desc: Content deductible that can be used, for example, to account for fire policies before applying step functions.
DeductibleContentsAcc.name: DeductibleContents

PayOutContentsStartAcc.field_desc: Pay-out amount for the contents losses for this step. If a ramp policy then it represents the start payout value.
PayOutContentsStartAcc.name: PayOutContentsStart

PayOutContentsEndAcc.field_desc: Pay-out amount for the end-point contents losses for this ramp. This field should only be used if you have a ramp policy to indicate the end of the contents payout. Otherwise, it should be left blank.
PayOutContentsEndAcc.name: PayOutContentsEnd

TriggerBuildingContentsStartAcc.field_desc: Starting value of the building and content damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.
TriggerBuildingContentsStartAcc.name: TriggerBuildingContentsStart

TriggerBuildingContentsEndAcc.field_desc: Ending value of the building and content damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.
TriggerBuildingContentsEndAcc.name: TriggerBuildingContentsEnd

DeductibleBuildingContentsAcc.field_desc: Building and contents deductible that can be used, for example, to account for fire policies before applying step functions.
DeductibleBuildingContentsAcc.name: DeductibleBuildingContents

PayOutBuildingContentsStartAcc.field_desc: Pay-out amount for the building and contents losses for this step. If a ramp policy then it represents the start payout value.
PayOutBuildingContentsStartAcc.name: PayOutBuildingContentsStart

PayOutBuildingContentsEndAcc.field_desc: Pay-out amount for the end-point building and contents losses for this ramp. This field should only be used if you have a ramp policy to indicate the end of the building and contents payout. Otherwise, it should be left blank.
PayOutBuildingContentsEndAcc.name: PayOutBuildingContentsEnd

PayOutLimitBuildingContentsAcc.field_desc: Pay-out limit for building and contents
PayOutLimitBuildingContentsAcc.name: PayOutLimitBuildingContents

ExtraExpenseFactorAcc.field_desc: A factor that is applied to main coverage loss for extra expenses. This value, entered as a decimal, should be the same for all steps for a policy contract and must be a value >0 and ≤1. For example, 0.12 for 12%.
ExtraExpenseFactorAcc.name: ExtraExpenseFactor

ExtraExpenseLimitAcc.field_desc: A limit that applies to the total extra expense loss
ExtraExpenseLimitAcc.name: ExtraExpenseLimit

DebrisRemovalFactorAcc.field_desc: A factor for a conditional coverage which tends to apply to all steps and is to cover Debris Removal. This value, entered as a decimal, should be the same for all steps for a policy contract and must be a value >0 and ≤1. For example, 0.12 for 12%.
DebrisRemovalFactorAcc.name: DebrisRemovalFactor

MinimumTIVAcc.field_desc: Minimum replacement value for which pay-outs to the corresponding damage range will be allowed.
MinimumTIVAcc.name: MinimumTIV

ScaleFactorAcc.field_desc: Percentage factor used to scale calculated losses. This value, entered as a decimal, should be the same for all steps for a policy contract and must be a value >0 and ≤1. For example, 0.12 for 12%.
ScaleFactorAcc.name: ScaleFactor

IsLimitAtDamageAcc.field_desc: Indicates whether the pay-out is limited by the actual ground-up loss.
IsLimitAtDamageAcc.name: IsLimitAtDamage

FlexiPolZZZAcc.field_desc: Flexible field that is stored in FlexiPol table in ModifierName = ZZZ
FlexiPolZZZAcc.name: FlexiPolZZZ

CondNumberAcc.field_desc: Condition number identifies a unique set of condition financial terms applicable to one or more CondTag's.
CondNumberAcc.name: CondNumber

CondPriorityAcc.field_desc: Condition priority: specifies the order in which special conditions apply if multiple conditions apply to one location.
CondPriorityAcc.name: CondPriority

CondDedCode2OtherAcc.field_desc: Special condition other building deductible code
CondDedCode2OtherAcc.name: CondDedCode2Other

CondDedType2OtherAcc.field_desc: Special condition other building deductible type
CondDedType2OtherAcc.name: CondDedType2Other

CondMinDed2OtherAcc.field_desc: Special condition minimum other building deductible
CondMinDed2OtherAcc.name: CondMinDed2Other

CondMaxDed2OtherAcc.field_desc: Special condition maximum other building deductible
CondMaxDed2OtherAcc.name: CondMaxDed2Other

CondLimitCode2OtherAcc.field_desc: Special condition other building limit code
CondLimitCode2OtherAcc.name: CondLimitCode2Other

CondLimitType2OtherAcc.field_desc: Special condition other building limit type
CondLimitType2OtherAcc.name: CondLimitType2Other

CorrelationGroupLoc.field_desc: Correlation Group: indicates which locations should be correlated between each other in Oasis LMF.
CorrelationGroupLoc.name: CorrelationGroup

IsPrimaryLoc.field_desc: Whether the location in LocGroup is the primary building in the group
IsPrimaryLoc.name: IsPrimary

IsTenantLoc.field_desc: Whether property is occupied by a tenant or not
IsTenantLoc.name: IsTenant

LocInceptionDateLoc.field_desc: Location inception date - in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD
LocInceptionDateLoc.name: LocInceptionDate

LocExpiryDateLoc.field_desc: Location expiry date - in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD
LocExpiryDateLoc.name: LocExpiryDate

PercentCompleteLoc.field_desc: Completeness percentage of the construction project at this location. The project completion percentage is by the cost of the project. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% enterd as 0.12)
PercentCompleteLoc.name: PercentComplete

CompletionDateLoc.field_desc: Construction project completion date - in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD
CompletionDateLoc.name: CompletionDate

CountryCodeLoc.field_desc: Country code (based on ISO3166 alpha-2 codes)
CountryCodeLoc.name: CountryCode

PostalCodeLoc.field_desc: Postcode: the highest resolution postcode most often used. (e.g. 5 digit zip for the US).
PostalCodeLoc.name: PostalCode

AreaCodeLoc.field_desc: Code representing typically the largest sub-division in a country (e.g. State code). See AreaCode Values sheet for details.
AreaCodeLoc.name: AreaCode

AreaNameLoc.field_desc: Name relating to the AreaCode (e.g. State name). See AreaCode Values sheet for details.
AreaNameLoc.name: AreaName

GeogSchemeXXLoc.field_desc: Geography scheme: Descriptor of the geography scheme used in relation to the geography name in the corresponding GeogName field (e.g. PC4). The 'XX' must be changed to an integer (GeogScheme1......> GeogScheme20 etc) and the user can specify values in addition to those listed in the GeogScheme values list, but user defined scheme values must start with 'X'.
GeogSchemeXXLoc.name: GeogSchemeXX

GeogNameXXLoc.field_desc: Geography name: Descriptor of the geographical area, using the scheme referenced in the corresponding GeogScheme field (e.g. SO31)
GeogNameXXLoc.name: GeogNameXX

AddressMatchLoc.field_desc: Address match from geocoder: indicating the resolution that the latitude / longitude represents
AddressMatchLoc.name: AddressMatch

GeocodeQualityLoc.field_desc: Geocode quality (values between 0 and 1 e.g. 80% is entered as 0.8)
GeocodeQualityLoc.name: GeocodeQuality

GeocoderLoc.field_desc: Company name / version of geocoder. Free text field.
GeocoderLoc.name: Geocoder

FloorAreaLoc.field_desc: Floor area: the total area across all floors
FloorAreaLoc.name: FloorArea

FloorAreaUnitLoc.field_desc: Units in which FloorArea is specified
FloorAreaUnitLoc.name: FloorAreaUnit

FlexiLocZZZLoc.field_desc: Flexible field that is stored in FlexiLoc table in ModifierName = ZZZ
FlexiLocZZZLoc.name: FlexiLocZZZ

OtherTIVLoc.field_desc: Other Building Insured Value (primarily aimed at specific US policies). For motor exposures, use this field for TIV along with appropriate motor construction code.
OtherTIVLoc.name: OtherTIV

BIPOILoc.field_desc: BI period of indemnity (in days, in increments of 0.5 days). Default value = 365 (1 year).
BIPOILoc.name: BIPOI

LocGrossPremiumLoc.field_desc: Gross premium amount at location level
LocGrossPremiumLoc.name: LocGrossPremium

LocTaxLoc.field_desc: Insurance tax amount at location level
LocTaxLoc.name: LocTax

NonCatGroundUpLossLoc.field_desc: Ground-Up non-cat loss value prior to the application of non-cat policy terms
NonCatGroundUpLossLoc.name: NonCatGroundUpLoss

LocParticipationLoc.field_desc: Percentage of risk that the insurer covers for this location. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% enterd as 0.12). Usually used in binders or offshore.
LocParticipationLoc.name: LocParticipation

PayoutBasisLoc.field_desc: Pay-out basis for the claim (whether depreciation is taken into account). ACV = RCV - depreciation.
PayoutBasisLoc.name: PayoutBasis

ReinsTagLoc.field_desc: User defined reinsurance tag to provide a further option for specifying reinsurance scope
ReinsTagLoc.name: ReinsTag

YearUpgradedLoc.field_desc: Year the building was upgraded (4 digit year)
YearUpgradedLoc.name: YearUpgraded

SurgeLeakageLoc.field_desc: Storm leakage percentage (0% to 100%) for Wind only policies
SurgeLeakageLoc.name: SurgeLeakage

PercentSprinkleredLoc.field_desc: Percent sprinklered. Values between 0 and 1 inclusive (0.5 = 50%); -999 is unknown
PercentSprinkleredLoc.name: PercentSprinklered

RoofCoverLoc.field_desc: Code that represents the material used to cover the roof
RoofCoverLoc.name: RoofCover

RoofYearBuiltLoc.field_desc: Year the roof was last replaced (4 digit year)
RoofYearBuiltLoc.name: RoofYearBuilt

RoofGeometryLoc.field_desc: Code that represents the shape of the roof
RoofGeometryLoc.name: RoofGeometry

RoofEquipmentLoc.field_desc: captures if mechanical or electric equipment is braced on the roof and the impact this modifier will have on the losses.
RoofEquipmentLoc.name: RoofEquipment

RoofMaintenanceLoc.field_desc: Captures the impact roof maintenance has on the losses
RoofMaintenanceLoc.name: RoofMaintenance

RoofAttachedStructuresLoc.field_desc: Code that identifies items mounted on the roof, such as A/C units, skylights, or dormers
RoofAttachedStructuresLoc.name: RoofAttachedStructures

RoofDeckLoc.field_desc: Code that represents the materials used to construct the roof deck
RoofDeckLoc.name: RoofDeck

RoofPitchLoc.field_desc: Code that represents the slope of the roof
RoofPitchLoc.name: RoofPitch

RoofAnchorageLoc.field_desc: Code that represents the connections used to secure the roof support system to the walls
RoofAnchorageLoc.name: RoofAnchorage

RoofDeckAttachmentLoc.field_desc: Code that represents the connections used to secure the roof deck to the underlying roof support system
RoofDeckAttachmentLoc.name: RoofDeckAttachment

RoofCoverAttachmentLoc.field_desc: Code that represents the connections used to secure the roof covering to the roof deck
RoofCoverAttachmentLoc.name: RoofCoverAttachment

GlassTypeLoc.field_desc: Code that represents the type of glass used in the building
GlassTypeLoc.name: GlassType

LatticeTypeLoc.field_desc: Code that represents the type of web used for H-shaped steel
LatticeTypeLoc.name: LatticeType

SoftStoryLoc.field_desc: Code that indicates if there is structural weakness at any floor.  First floor garages and taller first floors are likely to exhibit soft-story behaviour.
SoftStoryLoc.name: SoftStory

BasementLoc.field_desc: Code that defines if there is a basement and if so whether it is finished or unfinished
BasementLoc.name: Basement

BasementLevelCountLoc.field_desc: Indicates the number of basement levels in a structure (supports up to 5 levels; for more than 5, enter 5).
BasementLevelCountLoc.name: BasementLevelCount

WindowProtectionLoc.field_desc: Code that represents the wind protection systems used on the windows
WindowProtectionLoc.name: WindowProtection

FoundationTypeLoc.field_desc: Code that represents the construction type of the building's foundation
FoundationTypeLoc.name: FoundationType

WallAttachedStructureLoc.field_desc: Code that represents a structure that is physically attached to the building, such as garage or balcony
WallAttachedStructureLoc.name: WallAttachedStructure

AppurtenantStructureLoc.field_desc: Code for the appurtenant building, such as shed or detached garage
AppurtenantStructureLoc.name: AppurtenantStructure

GroundEquipmentLoc.field_desc: Captures whether mechanical or electrical equipment are present on the ground level of a building and impact it has on losses
GroundEquipmentLoc.name: GroundEquipment

EquipmentBracingLoc.field_desc: Identifies where mechanical or electrical equipment is held in place by bracing
EquipmentBracingLoc.name: EquipmentBracing

FlashingLoc.field_desc: Refers to the impact the quality of the flashing or coping on a roof has on losses
FlashingLoc.name: Flashing

BuildingShapeLoc.field_desc: Code that represents the shape of the building
BuildingShapeLoc.name: BuildingShape

ShapeIrregularityLoc.field_desc: Identifies vertical irregularities, overhangs and setbacks in the building design
ShapeIrregularityLoc.name: ShapeIrregularity

PoundingLoc.field_desc: Code that represents the distance to the closest structure, which if not adequate, can cause the two structures to collide during earthquake shaking
PoundingLoc.name: Pounding

OrnamentationLoc.field_desc: Code that represents the amount of decorative elements attached to the exterior of a building
OrnamentationLoc.name: Ornamentation

SpecialEQConstructionLoc.field_desc: Presence of a seismic base isolation system
SpecialEQConstructionLoc.name: SpecialEQConstruction

RetrofitLoc.field_desc: Presence of retro fit connectivity between walls and floor for retro fit buildings
RetrofitLoc.name: Retrofit

CrippleWallLoc.field_desc: Presence of cripple walls on the first floor or frame buildings
CrippleWallLoc.name: CrippleWall

FoundationConnectionLoc.field_desc: Connection of frame to foundation with or without bolts
FoundationConnectionLoc.name: FoundationConnection

ShortColumnLoc.field_desc: Code that indicates if there are short columns in the building
ShortColumnLoc.name: ShortColumn

FatigueLoc.field_desc: Captures signs of damage from prior earthquakes
FatigueLoc.name: Fatigue

CladdingLoc.field_desc: The presence and material of exterior building cladding
CladdingLoc.name: Cladding

FirstFloorHeightLoc.field_desc: Height of the lowest floor (above ground) of the building with respect to local ground elevation (NOT relative to datum). First floor in the US is identical to ground floor in Europe.
FirstFloorHeightLoc.name: FirstFloorHeight

FirstFloorHeightUnitLoc.field_desc: Code for the unit of measure used to express FirstFloorHeight
FirstFloorHeightUnitLoc.name: FirstFloorHeightUnit

DatumLoc.field_desc: Datum reference for the elevation fields (e.g. NAVD88; WGS84)
DatumLoc.name: Datum

GroundElevationLoc.field_desc: Flood or Windstorm - Elevation of the local ground surface at the building at this location. This field represents the elevation of the grade (local ground surface) with respect to the datum (e.g. NAVD88).
GroundElevationLoc.name: GroundElevation

GroundElevationUnitLoc.field_desc: Code for the unit of measure used to express the GroundElevation
GroundElevationUnitLoc.name: GroundElevationUnit

TankLoc.field_desc: Code that indicates if there are rooftop tanks on the adjoining higher buildings
TankLoc.name: Tank

RedundancyLoc.field_desc: Indicates whether there are multiple lateral load resisting elements, such as frames or shear walls
RedundancyLoc.name: Redundancy

InternalPartitionLoc.field_desc: Interior wall partitions or chimneys made from URM
InternalPartitionLoc.name: InternalPartition

ExternalDoorsLoc.field_desc: Wind resistant doors, doors with a certain rating of hurricane protection
ExternalDoorsLoc.name: ExternalDoors

TorsionLoc.field_desc: Code that represents the layout of structural elements that can lead to torsional loads
TorsionLoc.name: Torsion

MechanicalEquipmentSideLoc.field_desc: Mechanical or electrical equipment at the side
MechanicalEquipmentSideLoc.name: MechanicalEquipmentSide

ContentsWindVulnLoc.field_desc: Contents relative vulnerability to windstorm or tornado
ContentsWindVulnLoc.name: ContentsWindVuln

SmallDebrisLoc.field_desc: Code that identifies whether small debris are present within 200 meters of the structure
SmallDebrisLoc.name: SmallDebris

FloorsOccupiedLoc.field_desc: Number of floors in the building that are occupied (separated by semi-colons). Each floor occupied is separated by a semi-colon. Ranges are not accepted. 0 = ground floor, -1 = first level of basement, -2 = second level of basement; 1 = first floor, 2 = second floor, etc.
FloorsOccupiedLoc.name: FloorsOccupied

FloodDefenseHeightLoc.field_desc: Height of any site specific flood defenses protecting the property with respect to local ground elevation (NOT to datum).
FloodDefenseHeightLoc.name: FloodDefenseHeight

FloodDefenseHeightUnitLoc.field_desc: Code for the unit of measure used to express the FloodDefenseHeight
FloodDefenseHeightUnitLoc.name: FloodDefenseHeightUnit

FloodDebrisResilienceLoc.field_desc: Shows if building is vulnerable to floating debris
FloodDebrisResilienceLoc.name: FloodDebrisResilience

BaseFloodElevationLoc.field_desc: Water surface elevation (relative to datum - this is NOT a flood depth) corresponding to a flood having a 1% probability of being equaled or exceeded in a given year. A value of -999 for this field represents unknown/default.
BaseFloodElevationLoc.name: BaseFloodElevation

BaseFloodElevationUnitLoc.field_desc: Code for the unit of measure used to express the BaseFloodElevation
BaseFloodElevationUnitLoc.name: BaseFloodElevationUnit

BuildingValuationLoc.field_desc: Field for third party valuation data
BuildingValuationLoc.name: BuildingValuation

TreeExposureLoc.field_desc: Secondary modifier coding density of trees adjacent to structure
TreeExposureLoc.name: TreeExposure

ChimneyLoc.field_desc: Code that indicates if the structure has a chimney and, if so, the height of the chimney
ChimneyLoc.name: Chimney

PackagingLoc.field_desc: Describes the susceptibility of the packaging of a risk to the peril
PackagingLoc.name: Packaging

ProtectionLoc.field_desc: Describes the level of protection from the specific peril
ProtectionLoc.name: Protection

SalvageProtectionLoc.field_desc: The salvage potential of a particular product
SalvageProtectionLoc.name: SalvageProtection

ValuablesStorageLoc.field_desc: Where the specie element is stored
ValuablesStorageLoc.name: ValuablesStorage

DaysHeldLoc.field_desc: Number of days cargo is kept at port or the duration of an exhibition. Values between 0 to 1825 (up to 5 years). Default = 365.
DaysHeldLoc.name: DaysHeld

BrickVeneerLoc.field_desc: Code that represents the percentage of external walls that consist of brick veneer.
BrickVeneerLoc.name: BrickVeneer

FEMAComplianceLoc.field_desc: Indicates whether the building is in compliance with the FEMA flood zone requirements in both design and construction
FEMAComplianceLoc.name: FEMACompliance

CustomFloodSOPLoc.field_desc: Standard of flood protection return period; values from 0-10,000
CustomFloodSOPLoc.name: CustomFloodSOP

MultiStoryHallLoc.field_desc: Code that indicates if the building has a multi-story hall
MultiStoryHallLoc.name: MultiStoryHall

BuildingExteriorOpeningLoc.field_desc: Code that represents the percentage of exterior walls that are open (i.e. have windows or doors)
BuildingExteriorOpeningLoc.name: BuildingExteriorOpening

ServiceEquipmentProtectionLoc.field_desc: Code that indicates whether the service equipment is protected from flood
ServiceEquipmentProtectionLoc.name: ServiceEquipmentProtection

TallOneStoryLoc.field_desc: The height of the taller than usual one-story building (e.g. gymnasium, auditorium, church, etc.)
TallOneStoryLoc.name: TallOneStory

ReinsLayerNumberReinsInfo.field_desc: Reinsurance layer for information / ordering purposes
ReinsLayerNumberReinsInfo.name: ReinsLayerNumber

ReinsInceptionDateReinsInfo.field_desc: Reinsurance inception date - in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD
ReinsInceptionDateReinsInfo.name: ReinsInceptionDate

ReinsExpiryDateReinsInfo.field_desc: Reinsurance expiry date - in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD
ReinsExpiryDateReinsInfo.name: ReinsExpiryDate

CededPercentReinsInfo.field_desc: Reinsurance ceded percentage. Used mainly in surplus treaties. Applies before other reinsurance terms. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% entered as 0.12)
CededPercentReinsInfo.name: CededPercent

OccReverseFranchiseReinsInfo.field_desc: Reinsurance reverse franchise - a value of loss that, if exceeded, results in no payment being made for this event from the reinsurer to insurer.
OccReverseFranchiseReinsInfo.name: OccReverseFranchise

AggLimitReinsInfo.field_desc: Maximum amount payable under this treaty during the AggPeriod
AggLimitReinsInfo.name: AggLimit

AggAttachmentReinsInfo.field_desc: The aggregate monetary amount during a given AggPeriod that the resinured retains under this treaty
AggAttachmentReinsInfo.name: AggAttachment

AggPeriodReinsInfo.field_desc: Aggregate period associated with the aggregate limits and attachments (in days). Default value = 365 (1 year)
AggPeriodReinsInfo.name: AggPeriod

PlacedPercentReinsInfo.field_desc: Percentage of the limit that has been placed in the reinsurance market. The main percentage used for reinsurance treaties other than surplus. Applies after other reinsurance terms. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% entered as 0.12)
PlacedPercentReinsInfo.name: PlacedPercent

InuringPriorityReinsInfo.field_desc: Reinsurance inuring priority capturing the order in which reinsurance contracts apply. Treaties with lower number inuring priorities apply first.
InuringPriorityReinsInfo.name: InuringPriority

ReinstatementChargeReinsInfo.field_desc: Reinstatement charge as %; semi-colon separated if different for each reinstatement (e.g. 1-free, 2-50%, 3-100% should be entered as: 0;0.5;1). If all reinstatements are the same, then just one number is sufficient (e.g. 3 reinstatements at 100% should be entered as 1)
ReinstatementChargeReinsInfo.name: ReinstatementCharge

DeemedPercentPlacedReinsInfo.field_desc: Deemed percent placed, used to represent notional contracts or any part of the contract being notional. For fully notional contracts, enter 1 (i.e. 100%). For partially placed contracts, enter any value between 0 and 1. For real contracts, enter 0.
DeemedPercentPlacedReinsInfo.name: DeemedPercentPlaced

ReinsFXrateReinsInfo.field_desc: Reinsurance exchange rate (as the contractual reinsurance rate can be different from the actual exchange rates used for policies and locations)
ReinsFXrateReinsInfo.name: ReinsFXrate

TreatyShareReinsInfo.field_desc: The percentage of a treaty that a given reinsurer may write. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% entered as 0.12).
TreatyShareReinsInfo.name: TreatyShare

UseReinsDatesReinsInfo.field_desc: A flag to indicate if reinsurance contract dates or  policy inception / expiry dates are to be considered when calculating losses (Y) or ignored (N).
UseReinsDatesReinsInfo.name: UseReinsDates

ReinsNumberReinsScope.field_desc: Reinsurance number to link with ReinsInfo file
ReinsNumberReinsScope.name: ReinsNumber

PortNumberReinsScope.field_desc: Portfolio number: used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file
PortNumberReinsScope.name: PortNumber

AccNumberReinsScope.field_desc: Account number:  used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file
AccNumberReinsScope.name: AccNumber

PolNumberReinsScope.field_desc: Policy number:  used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file
PolNumberReinsScope.name: PolNumber

LocGroupReinsScope.field_desc: Location group name:  used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file
LocGroupReinsScope.name: LocGroup

LocNumberReinsScope.field_desc: Location number:  used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file
LocNumberReinsScope.name: LocNumber

CedantNameReinsScope.field_desc: Cedant name:  used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file
CedantNameReinsScope.name: CedantName

ProducerNameReinsScope.field_desc: Producer name:  used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file
ProducerNameReinsScope.name: ProducerName

LOBReinsScope.field_desc: Line of business:  used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file
LOBReinsScope.name: LOB

CountryCodeReinsScope.field_desc: Country code: used for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file
CountryCodeReinsScope.name: CountryCode

ReinsTagReinsScope.field_desc: Reinsurance tag: user defined field to for defining treaty scope in the reinsurance scope file
ReinsTagReinsScope.name: ReinsTag

CededPercentReinsScope.field_desc: Ceded percentage (for 12%, enter 0.12). Within the reinsurance scope file, CededPercent should only be entered for surplus share treaties.
CededPercentReinsScope.name: CededPercent

RiskLevelReinsInfo.field_desc: Code to indicate the definition of 'risk' for the per-risk terms in this particular treaty (or portion of the treaty)
RiskLevelReinsInfo.name: RiskLevel

StaticMotorVehicleLoc.field_desc: Identifies whether a risk is static or dynamic (moves from location to location)
StaticMotorVehicleLoc.name: StaticMotorVehicle

CondClassAcc.field_desc: Flags whether a condition is a policy restriction
CondClassAcc.name: CondClass

CondTagAcc; Loc.field_desc: Identifies a group of locations which are subject to one or more conditions.
CondTagAcc; Loc.name: CondTag

OEDVersionAcc; Loc; ReinsInfo; ReinsScop.field_desc: The OED schema version of the file
OEDVersionAcc; Loc; ReinsInfo; ReinsScop.name: OEDVersion

IsAggregateLoc.field_desc: Agggrated Data based on NumberOfBuildings field
IsAggregateLoc.name: IsAggregate
